page.title: 01Our School.
page.content: The school was built in 1969 under the North Riding Authority. Since 1974 the school has been within the newer 'Cleveland' county. The school caters for children from 7 to 11 years of age. There are now 330 children on roll, after a a peak of 450 in the late 70's. There are 14 members of staff. The school has its own kitchen providing some 240 meals daily. The curriculum ranges through Needlework, P.E., Computer Studies, Science, Music, and basic 'three R' subjects. The school organises visits to Belgium and, more locally, summer camping weekends. We are one of three Skelton Schools. There is an Infant school, and De Brus Comprehensive School named after the famous Robert who lived here
